site_name: 20 Queensberry House Friars LaneRichmondTW9 1NT
description: Rear Garden @ No.3 The WardrobeT1 - Lime (Tilia x europa) - Reduce by approximately 2m back to most recent previous reduction points (Re-pollard). Final height 6m and spread 2m.T2	Lime (Tilia x europa)	Reduce by approximately 2m back to most recent previous reduction points (Re-pollard). Final height 6m and spread 2m.T3	Lime (Tilia x europa)	Reduce by approximately 2m back to most recent previous reduction points (Re-pollard). Final height 6m and spread 2m.T4	Lime (Tilia x europa)	Reduce by approximately 2m back to most recent previous reduction points (Re-pollard). Final height 6m and spread 2mRear Garden @ Queensbury houseT1	Box Elder (Acer negundo)	Crown Reduction 30% - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by approximately 2m, to rebalance and reshape. Final height 4m and spread 4m. T2	Mullberry (Morus spp)	Remove limb resting on the concrete archway.T3	Horse Chestnut (Aesculus hippocastanum)	Reduce low heavy limb by 2-3m to alleviate some end weight and reduce the risk of failure. There is an old wound at the base of this limb from an historical limb failure, which had visible fungal fruiting bodies emanating from it at the time of inspection, indicating ingress of decay at the old wound site. Therefore it would be prudent to significantly reduce this limb to reduce the risk of future failure.
